msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Fixed bug where we might drop some fault events that should be delivered when we are not
able to connect.  We batch up messages waiting for a clientId to be assigned in the
clientIdWaitQueue.  When flushing this queue, if we have no clientId (i.e. we are likely
faulting these messages), if there was more than one message in the queue, we'd just end up
putting the messages right back in the queue instead of faulting it.  With this change,
we null out the queue temporarily so that internalSend faults the message.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Fix for missing fault events at connect time for MessageAgents with needsConfig flags set true before connecting.
QA: Related to fixes by Jeff for LCDS-542, LCDS-541, LCDS-540, LCDS-539
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Checking in for netmon support for mx:DataService and mx:MessageService (for FB). We tested these changes with check in tests for network monitor. This has been reviewed by Seth Hodgson. No bugs were fixed with this change. No change in documentation in SDK. This needs to be backported to SDK3 (for support for SDK3 as well). This backporting would be done later.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Bugs: BLZ-287 - Potential null pointer in MessageAgent set destination method.
LCDS-522 - Add more configurable reconnect handling for connecting up again over the same channel when there is a connection failure/outage.
* MessageAgent (conceptually an abstract class but that's not supported by ActionScript) now defines a default value for the agentType member used in logging output - fixes BLZ-287.

* ChannelSet now resets to the beginning on its channels upon manual disconnects or otherwise. This fixes the scenario of starting off on streaming or RTMP, loosing connectivity temporarily and then getting stuck on a fallback polling channel. Chances of reconnecting on the preferred channel are better now, and manual disconnects/reconnects if you end up on a fallback channel that you don't want to stick with are now possible.
* Also, updates to Channel to support LCDS-522, and longer-duration reliable messaging reconnects.
